snippet.title: Amazon launches Kindle content service for kids
snippet.description: NEW YORK (AP) Amazon is launching a subscription service for children's games, videos and books aimed at getting more kids to use its Kindle Fire tablet devices. Amazon.com Inc. announced Wednesday that the Kindle FreeTime Unlimited service will be available in the next few weeks as part of

snippet.title: Journal Sentinel debuts on Amazon's Kindle reader
snippet.description: The Kindle edition contains all articles that appear in the print edition of the Journal Sentinel. At this time, ads do not appear in the Kindle edition. The Journal Sentinel is available on Amazon's Kindle electronic reading device, the company said Thursday. The Kindle edition contains all articles

snippet.title: Kindle Cloud Reader for iOS & Chrome
snippet.description: Amazon announced its Kindle Cloud Reader today, a mobile site using HTML5 to let readers enjoy Kindle books using the Safari Web browser iPad, Safari on desktop computers and Google's Chrome. Similar to all of the Kindle apps, Kindle Cloud Reader automatically synchronizes a digital

snippet.title: Amazon highlights apps on the Kindle Fire
snippet.description: Teasing to the impending release of its budget-friendlier Kindle Fire next week, Amazon today highlighted several of the apps that will be available on the tablet at launch, including Netflix, Rhapsody, Pandora, Twitter and Facebook. The list -- which also includes games from Zynga, EA,

snippet.title: With Kindle as a competitor, Sony gets no respect
snippet.description: So is Sony just getting left in the dust by Amazon? Amazon, uber-book seller and marketer of the Kindle 2, is expected to announce an electronic book reader today that will make it easier to peruse newspapers, magazines and textbooks online. The thing will likely

snippet.title: Amazon selling more e-books than print editions
snippet.description: Amazon is now selling more Kindle e-books than print books. The company introduced the Kindle in Nov. 2007, and by July 2010 Kindle book sales had surpassed hardcover book sales, the company says. Six months later, Kindle books passed paperbacks, becoming the most popular format sold on the
